formatted_address: 5001 Beach Rd, Golden Mile Complex, Singapore 199588
name: The Golden Mile

reviews.text: Go to place for real Thai foods. At least there are many choices there, just select according to ypur taste. Toilet and general areas are a bit dark (less lighting) but if you are not bothered, then it’s ok. Else, don’t go alone so you won’t get scared or shocked easily.

Dropped by for a heritage tour over the weekends and also popped by the Thai supermarket to grab the fried bananas and sweet potato balls!! Pls do so before they shift out in early April! Many of the stalls have also shifted out/will be shifting out by March so do drop by before it’s too late..

I’m Vietnamese  live in Singapore, and I feel happy when come here. They have many types vegetables which I cannot buy in my market.

But the place a bit old and not safe, should protect your bag or phone, and women shouldn’t go at night. The dessert looks so nice but eat not nice, shouldn’t buy too much like me and quit it.

Good plc for lunch.  Many choices.  Basement many muslim stalls.  Malay satay very good.  Meaty & juicy.  Seldom can find such delicious satay.  Bugis beef noodle no nd to mention much.  Booss said is 40y+ brand. Dont miss the $1 TT from indian muslim auntie.  Charcoal burger is juicy, fries is special, diff fr FF.

For authentic Thai noodles, go to Flying Pig (level 1). It's a small restaurant which serves Thai noodles, Thai salads, and Crab omelette rice (must try!).
Love their homemade drinks (butterfly pea and Roselle).
